intro: Echium columnae, commonly known as the slender fleur-de-lis, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showing a preference for well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces a tall, erect stem. Echium columnae is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
